required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Prevalence and Location of Intra-Procedural Atelectasis Detected by Radial-Probe Endobronchial Ultrasound During Peripheral Bronchoscopy Under General Anesthesia
clinical_study.official_title: Prevalence and Location of Intra-Procedural Atelectasis Detected by Radial-Probe Endobronchial Ultrasound During Peripheral Bronchoscopy Under General Anesthesia

brief_summary.textblock:
The goal of this clinical research study is to learn if and how often a standard procedure called endobronchial ultrasound-guided transbronchial needle aspiration (EBUS-TBNA) may cause atelectasis. Atelectasis is the complete or partial collapse of the lung which may cause difficulty breathing.
This is an investigational study. EBUS-TBNA is performed using FDA-approved and commercially available methods.
The EBUS-TBNA procedures will be performed as part of participant's standard of care.
Up to 57 participants will be enrolled on this study. All participants will take part at MD Anderson.

detailed_description.textblock:
If participant agrees to take part in this study, participant will have standard clinical tests to check the status of the disease and to look for lymph nodes to which the disease has spread. This will be done using EBUS-TBNA. Participant will sign separate consent forms for these procedures.
After the EBUS-TBNA, the study staff will take pictures of participant's lung by using the same probe which was used during EBUS-TBNA. This will add about 3-5 minutes to the procedure time.
For the purposes of this study, information about participant (such as participant's medical history and demographic information [age, sex, race, and so on]) will be collected along with the results of the clinical tests that are being performed as part of participant's standard of care.
Participant's active participation in the study will be over after participant's EBUS-TBNA. However, the study staff will continue to collect information about participant's health from participant's medical record indefinitely (without a set time limit).

primary_outcome.measure: Presence or Absence of New Atelectasis for Each Segment
primary_outcome.description: After identifying the presence or absence of new atelectasis for each segment, patients with at least 1 segment containing a new atelectasis determined to have atelectasis. Patients without atelectasis within any of the 8 segments determined to not have atelectasis.

clinical_study.condition: Malignant Neoplasms of Respiratory and Intrathoracic Organs

intervention.description: Participants receive EBUS-TBNA to look for lymph nodes to which the disease has spread. After the EBUS-TBNA, study staff will take pictures of participant's lung by using the same probe which was used during EBUS-TBNA. This will add about 3-5 minutes to the procedure time.

study_pop.textblock: Participants undergoing bronchoscopy at MD Anderson Cancer Center.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Adult patients (>18 years) undergoing bronchoscopy with radial EBUS for peripheral lung lesions
2. Recent CT performed no more than 4 weeks prior to the bronchoscopy
3. Voluntary informed consent to participate in the study
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Patients with baseline lung consolidation, interstitial changes or lung masses (> 3 cm in diameter) in dependent areas of the lung as seen on most recent CT
2. Pregnancy
3. Ascites
4. Known diaphragmatic paralysis

facility.name: University of Texas MD Anderson Cancer Center

link.description: University of Texas MD Anderson Cancer Center Website

clinical_study.keyword: Malignant neoplasms of respiratory and intrathoracic organs
